subject: Behavior of tearDown and exceptions
msgSnippet: Laurent s message about tearDown getting called reminded me of something I ve wanted to post to the list. A few weeks back I was working with some database
messageBody:
Laurent's message about tearDown getting called reminded me of something
I've wanted to post to the list.

A few weeks back I was working with some database tests and was getting odd
behavior. It took me a little while to figure it out, but what was
happening was a test method was throwing an exception because of some
database error. The tearDown method attempted to cleanup after the test and
it also threw a database exception. All I got back was the exception that
occurred in tearDown, not the exception that occurred in the test method.

It was a real pain because I had to modify the production code to catch and
print the exception so I could uncover the actual problem.

My preferred solution would be to print both exceptions. If I get an
exception in testFoo and in tearDown, JUnit should print the following:

1) testFoo(net.iss.FooTest)
java.lang.Exception
at ...
Exception in tearDown:
java.lang.Exception
at ...

I would be willing to put together a patch to do this. Comments?

Matt
